name: Nightmare on Swift Street: Swifty 13 Quiz | Brain Teasers | 10 Questions

questions.text:
EXAMPLE: "I like camping," said Tom ___.  The answer is INTENTLY. 

Note: The spellings are always correct English, although the pronunciation may not be. The hint will tell the number of words and letters.  Also the beginning and last letters IE: S/LY or S/D.  

QUESTION ONE:  "I've been listening to the 'Tales of Hoffman'," Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Often Barked.

	Often barked = Offenbach, the composer of "Tales of Hoffman".

questions.text: "I have to keep this fire blazing," Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Bellowed.

	A bellows is a device which blows air to keep fires burning.

questions.text: "I've been to San Francisco" said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Heartlessly.

	Per the old song..."I lost my heart in San Francisco"...if you've been there you are heart-less.

questions.text: "It's where we store the hay," Tom said ___.
questions.explanation:
Loftily.

	Hay is often stored in a loft.

questions.text: "Where shall I plant these water-lilies?" Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Pondered.

	Water Lilies grow in a pond.

questions.text: "I wonder if there's a number between seven and nine," said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Considerately & calculatingly.

	If you're curious about the number between seven and nine...consider eight...considerate

questions.text: "For what we are about to receive, may we be truly thankful," said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Gracefully.

	The quote is a form of pre-meal prayer of grace.

questions.text: "My parents are called Billy and Nanny," Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Kidded.

	The offspring of a billy goat and a nanny goat would be a kid.

questions.text: "I've joined the Airborne Medical Corps," said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Paradoxically.

	Airborne = Parachute = ParaMedical Corps = doc = dox
